Description: Granulated gold tetrahedral pendant portion of an earring, entirely made of globules welded together, with three bigger globules superimposed under the lower tip; an oval and concave trace on the centre of the top surface shows where the ring, now missing, was welded.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, Probably from the North-west Ptolemaic mound
Curator's comments: One of the gold "pieces of globule work, probably of earrings" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "part of gold earring, trihedral pyramid of soldered globules", p. 110, pl. xli, 13.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 13)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.82, p.186, pl.28)
Additional IDs: Other BM number: 1887,0101.546 (incorrect number marked on object)
